meanings.definition: Having small rounded projections or protuberances.
meanings.sent1: The cactus had a mammillated surface, making it look bumpy and textured.
meanings.sent2: Her skin felt mammillated, like tiny bumps under her fingertips.
meanings.sent3: The mammillated appearance of the cake frosting made it resemble a miniature mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The mammillated texture of the fabric reminded her of a field of tiny mushrooms.
meanings.sent5: The mammillated pattern on the ceiling created a cozy and interesting atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: Covered with small rounded bumps or nodules.
meanings.sent1: The toad's skin was mammillated, giving it a rough and textured appearance.
meanings.sent2: The mammillated surface of the rock made it difficult to climb without slipping.
meanings.sent3: The mammillated texture of the carpet felt like walking on a field of tiny hills.
meanings.sent4: Her hands explored the mammillated surface of the sculpture, feeling each bump and curve.
meanings.sent5: The mammillated shell of the turtle provided protection as well as a unique pattern.
